strengths.evidence: Strong running background, solid threshold pace

limiters.evidence: Needs technique refinement, limited open water experience

constraints: Pool access weekday mornings and evenings

sweetSpot.description: High aerobic benefit with manageable fatigue

phases.name: Base
phases.focus: Build aerobic foundation, technique refinement, establish training rhythm

phases.name: Build
phases.focus: Increase intensity, race-pace work, sweet spot bike training

phases.name: Peak
phases.focus: Race simulation, open water practice, peak fitness

workouts.name: Rest Day
workouts.description: Full recovery day - light stretching optional

workouts.name: Technique Foundation
workouts.description: Focus on catch mechanics and body rotation
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
200m easy freestyle
4x50m drill: catch-up, fingertip drag, fist, swim

MAIN SET (1000m):
4x100m @ 2:10/100m pace with 15s rest
Focus: High elbow catch, full extension
4x50m @ 2:05/100m with 10s rest
Focus: Hip rotation drives the stroke
200m pull with buoy - steady rhythm

COOL-DOWN (400m):
200m easy choice stroke
200m easy freestyle with bilateral breathing

workouts.name: Aerobic Foundation Ride
workouts.description: Steady aerobic effort, build cycling base
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (10 min):
10 min easy spin, gradually increase cadence to 85-90 rpm

MAIN SET (40 min):
40 min steady Zone 2 riding
Power: 110-150W (55-75% FTP)
Cadence: 85-95 rpm
Stay seated, smooth pedal stroke

COOL-DOWN (10 min):
10 min easy spin, legs turning over
Stretch hip flexors post-ride

workouts.name: Easy Aerobic Run
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
5 min walk/very easy jog

MAIN SET (30 min):
30 min easy running at 5:40-6:00/km
HR: 136-150 (Zone 2)
Focus: Relaxed shoulders, quick cadence (175-180 spm)
Breathing should be comfortable and conversational

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
5 min easy walk
Dynamic stretches: leg swings, lunges

workouts.name: Aerobic Swim
workouts.description: Build aerobic capacity with continuous swimming
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
300m easy freestyle
4x25m kick with fins

MAIN SET (1400m):
6x200m @ 2:05/100m with 20s rest
Negative split each 200 (second 100 faster)
Focus: Relaxed breathing pattern
200m pull with paddles - smooth and powerful

COOL-DOWN (400m):
200m easy backstroke
200m easy freestyle

workouts.name: Long Endurance Ride
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
15 min easy spinning
3x30s spin-ups to 100+ rpm

MAIN SET (60 min):
60 min steady Zone 2 riding
Power: 110-150W
Stay aero for 5-10 min blocks when comfortable
Practice drinking every 15 min

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin home
Post-ride: Nutrition within 30 min

workouts.name: Long Run
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
5 min easy walk/jog

MAIN SET (50 min):
50 min easy running at 5:45-6:10/km
HR: 136-150 (Zone 2)
Focus: Time on feet, relaxed form
Take water at 25 min if needed
Even effort throughout

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
5 min walk
Gentle stretching

workouts.name: Core & Stability
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
Dynamic stretches, arm circles, leg swings

MAIN CIRCUIT (25 min):
3 rounds with 30s rest between exercises:
- Plank: 45 sec
- Side plank: 30 sec each side
- Bird dogs: 10 each side
- Glute bridges: 15 reps
- Single-leg Romanian deadlifts: 8 each side
- Dead bugs: 10 each side
- Clamshells: 15 each side

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
Pigeon pose, hip flexor stretch, quad stretch

workouts.name: Drill Work + CSS Intro
workouts.description: Technique refinement with first CSS-pace touches
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
200m easy freestyle
4x50m (25 drill/25 swim): catch-up, zipper, fist, full stroke

DRILL SET (400m):
8x50m drill work @ 1:15 interval
Alternate: sculling, doggy paddle, single-arm
Focus: Feel the water pressure on your hand

MAIN SET (1000m):
5x100m @ 1:55/100m (CSS pace) with 15s rest
Focus: Maintain stroke count, breathe bilaterally
5x100m descend 1-5 with 15s rest
#1 easy, #5 fast

COOL-DOWN (400m):
200m easy pull
200m easy choice stroke

workouts.name: Aerobic Ride with Cadence Work
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (10 min):
10 min easy spin, building cadence

MAIN SET (50 min):
50 min Zone 2 with cadence drills:
Every 10 min: 1 min high cadence (100-110 rpm)
Power: 110-150W base
Focus: Smooth pedal stroke, eliminate dead spots

COOL-DOWN (10 min):
10 min easy spin
Post-ride stretching

workouts.name: Easy Run + Strides
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
5 min easy jog

MAIN SET (30 min):
30 min easy running at 5:40-6:00/km
HR: 136-150 (Zone 2)
Relaxed, conversational effort

STRIDES (5 min):
6x20 sec strides at fast (not sprint) pace
40 sec easy jog between
Focus: Quick feet, tall posture, relaxed arms

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
5 min easy jog/walk

workouts.name: Continuous Aerobic Swim
workouts.description: Build swim endurance with sighting practice
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
300m easy freestyle
4x25m sighting practice (look forward every 6 strokes)

MAIN SET (1600m):
1000m continuous @ 2:05/100m
Sight every 10 strokes (practice for open water)
2x300m @ 2:00/100m with 30s rest
Negative split each 300

COOL-DOWN (400m):
200m easy backstroke
200m easy freestyle

workouts.name: Intro Brick: Bike + Run
workouts.description: First brick workout of the plan
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE LEG (70 min):
Warm-up: 15 min easy
Main: 45 min Zone 2 @ 110-150W
Cool-down: 10 min easy

TRANSITION:
Quick change - practice T2 routine
Target: Under 3 minutes
Have shoes, hat, race belt ready

RUN LEG (25 min):
25 min easy running
First 5 min will feel awkward - this is normal!
Settle into rhythm by 10 min mark
Focus: Quick cadence, forward lean

workouts.name: Long Run
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
5 min easy walk/jog

MAIN SET (60 min):
60 min easy running at 5:40-6:00/km
HR: 136-150 (Zone 2)
Negative split: second half slightly faster
Water at 30 min

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
5 min walk
Gentle stretching

workouts.name: Triathlon-Specific Strength
workouts.description: Build functional strength for all three sports
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
Dynamic stretches, bodyweight squats

MAIN CIRCUIT (30 min):
3 rounds:
- Goblet squats: 12 reps
- Romanian deadlifts: 10 reps
- Step-ups: 10 each leg
- Push-ups: 12-15 reps
- Bent-over rows: 12 each arm
- Pallof press: 10 each side
- Copenhagen plank: 20 sec each side

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
Foam rolling: quads, IT band, calves

workouts.name: CSS Development Set
workouts.description: Build threshold capacity with CSS-pace work
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (500m):
300m easy freestyle
4x50m build (easy to fast)

PRE-MAIN (400m):
8x50m @ 1:55/100m with 10s rest
Focus on holding stroke rate

MAIN SET (1200m):
6x200m @ 1:55/100m (CSS) with 15s rest
Even splits - aim for same time each 200
Breathe every 3 strokes if possible

COOL-DOWN (500m):
300m easy pull
200m easy backstroke

workouts.name: Tempo Introduction
workouts.description: First structured tempo work on the bike
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
15 min progressive warm-up
End at moderate effort

MAIN SET (45 min):
3x10 min @ Tempo (150-180W, 75-90% FTP)
5 min easy spin between intervals
Cadence: 85-95 rpm
Focus: Steady power, no surging

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin
Stretch hip flexors

workouts.name: Tempo Introduction
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (12 min):
10 min easy jog
4x30s accelerations with 30s easy

MAIN SET (25 min):
2x10 min @ Tempo pace (5:00-5:10/km)
HR: 150-158 (Zone 3)
5 min easy jog between
Focus: Controlled effort, sustainable pace

COOL-DOWN (13 min):
10 min easy jog
3 min walk
Stretch quads, hip flexors, calves

workouts.name: Pull & Endurance
workouts.description: Build swim-specific strength with pull work
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
200m easy freestyle
200m easy backstroke

PULL SET (800m):
4x200m pull with buoy and paddles @ 2:00/100m
15s rest between
Focus: High elbow catch, powerful pull

MAIN SET (800m):
8x100m @ 2:00/100m with 15s rest
Descend 1-4, repeat 5-8
Smooth, efficient strokes

COOL-DOWN (400m):
200m easy kick with fins
200m easy freestyle

workouts.name: Long Endurance Ride
workouts.description: Build cycling endurance with aero practice
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
15 min easy spinning
Build to Zone 2

MAIN SET (75 min):
75 min Zone 2 riding @ 110-150W
Every 15 min: 3 min in aero position
Practice race position and comfort
Drink every 15 min, aim for 60g carbs/hour

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin
Note: Post-ride nutrition within 30 min

workouts.name: Progressive Long Run
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
5 min easy walk/jog

MAIN SET (65 min):
45 min easy @ 5:45-6:00/km (Zone 2)
Final 20 min: Pick up pace to 5:20-5:30/km
Negative split the run
Water/gel at 40 min

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
5 min easy walk
Stretch and foam roll

weeks.focus: Active recovery week - absorb base phase adaptations

workouts.name: Recovery Swim
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (200m):
200m very easy freestyle

MAIN SET (1000m):
4x50m technique drills (catch-up, fingertip)
6x100m easy @ 2:15/100m with 20s rest
Focus on form, not speed
200m easy pull with buoy

COOL-DOWN (200m):
100m easy backstroke
100m easy freestyle

workouts.name: Recovery Spin
workouts.description: Easy spin to keep legs moving
workouts.humanReadable:
RECOVERY RIDE:
45 min very easy spinning
Power: Under 110W (55% FTP)
Cadence: 90-100 rpm
High cadence, low resistance

This is about blood flow, not fitness
No hard efforts allowed!

workouts.name: Recovery Jog
workouts.description: Easy jog to maintain running feel
workouts.humanReadable:
RECOVERY RUN:
30 min very easy jogging
Pace: 6:00-6:30/km
HR: Under 136 (Zone 1)

This should feel effortless
Walk if HR gets too high
Flat terrain preferred

workouts.name: Easy Endurance Ride
workouts.humanReadable:
EASY ENDURANCE RIDE:
75 min Zone 2 riding
Power: 110-140W (lower end of Zone 2)
Cadence: 85-95 rpm

Enjoy the ride!
Stay relaxed
No pushing

workouts.name: Easy Continuous Swim
workouts.description: Relaxed swimming to end recovery week
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (200m):
200m easy freestyle

MAIN SET (1200m):
800m continuous @ comfortable pace
Mix of strokes okay
4x100m easy with 20s rest

COOL-DOWN (200m):
200m choice stroke

weeks.focus: Introduce intensity, sweet spot bike work begins

workouts.name: Power Development
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
Dynamic stretches, jumping jacks

MAIN CIRCUIT (30 min):
3 rounds:
- Jump squats: 8 reps (explosive)
- Bulgarian split squats: 8 each leg
- Box step-ups (quick): 10 each leg
- Push-ups with rotation: 10 reps
- Renegade rows: 8 each arm
- Medicine ball slams: 10 reps
- Plank with shoulder taps: 30 sec

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
Foam rolling and stretching

workouts.name: CSS Threshold Set
workouts.description: Sustained threshold work at CSS pace
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (500m):
300m easy freestyle
4x50m build @ 1:15

PRE-MAIN (400m):
4x100m @ 2:00/100m descending with 15s rest

MAIN SET (1400m):
7x200m @ 1:55/100m (CSS) with 15s rest
Hold stroke count and pace across all reps
Breathe bilaterally if possible

SPEED TOUCH (200m):
4x50m FAST @ :55 with 15s rest

COOL-DOWN (300m):
300m easy pull

workouts.name: Sweet Spot Intervals
workouts.description: Build muscular endurance with sweet spot work
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
15 min progressive build to moderate
Include 2x30s high cadence efforts

MAIN SET (45 min):
3x12 min @ Sweet Spot (168-194W, 84-97% FTP)
5 min easy spin between intervals
Cadence: 85-95 rpm
Stay in aero position when possible

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin
Post-ride: Protein and carbs within 30 min

workouts.name: Threshold Intervals
workouts.description: Build running threshold with structured intervals
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
10 min easy jog
4x30s strides with 30s easy
1 min easy jog

MAIN SET (28 min):
5x4 min @ Threshold (4:45-4:55/km)
HR: 158-168 (Zone 4)
90 sec easy jog recovery between
Focus: Controlled breathing, quick cadence

COOL-DOWN (12 min):
10 min easy jog
2 min walk
Stretch thoroughly

workouts.name: Aerobic Swim + Sighting
workouts.description: Build endurance with open water skills
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
200m easy freestyle
4x50m (25 sighting practice/25 swim)

MAIN SET (1600m):
1500m continuous @ 2:00/100m
Sight forward every 8-10 strokes
Practice "crocodile eyes" technique

KICK SET (200m):
4x50m kick with fins @ 1:10

COOL-DOWN (200m):
200m easy backstroke

workouts.name: Build Phase Brick
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE LEG (80 min):
Warm-up: 15 min easy
Main: 50 min with:
- 40 min Zone 2 @ 110-150W
- Final 10 min @ Tempo (150-175W)
Cool-down: 15 min easy
Practice race nutrition: 60g carbs/hour

TRANSITION (3 min):
Quick T2 practice
Shoes on, race belt, go!

RUN LEG (35 min):
First 20 min @ easy effort (5:40-6:00/km)
Final 15 min @ Tempo (5:00-5:15/km)
Focus: Transition to run legs quickly

workouts.name: Long Run
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
5 min easy walk/jog

MAIN SET (70 min):
70 min easy @ 5:40-5:55/km
HR: 136-150 (Zone 2)
Even effort throughout
Water and gel at 35 min
Practice race-day nutrition

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
5 min walk
Stretch and roll

workouts.name: Race Pace Set
workouts.description: Practice race pace with descending intervals
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (500m):
300m easy freestyle
4x50m drill/swim by 25

RACE PACE SET (1400m):
4x350m @ race pace (1:58-2:00/100m)
30s rest between
Even pace each 350
Sight every 10 strokes

SPEED SET (400m):
8x50m descend 1-4, repeat @ :55

COOL-DOWN (500m):
300m easy pull
200m easy backstroke

workouts.name: Extended Sweet Spot
workouts.description: Longer sweet spot intervals for race preparation
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
15 min progressive build
Include 3x30s high cadence

MAIN SET (50 min):
2x20 min @ Sweet Spot (168-194W)
10 min easy spin between
Cadence: 85-95 rpm
Practice aero position

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin

workouts.name: Tempo Run
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (12 min):
10 min easy jog
4x30s strides with 30s easy

MAIN SET (30 min):
25 min continuous @ Tempo (5:00-5:10/km)
HR: 150-158 (Zone 3)
Controlled, sustainable effort

COOL-DOWN (13 min):
10 min easy jog
3 min walk

workouts.name: Speed Development
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (500m):
300m easy freestyle
4x50m build @ 1:10

SPEED SET (1000m):
10x100m on ladder:
#1-4: @ 1:55/100m
#5-6: @ 1:50/100m (CSS)
#7-8: @ 1:45/100m (fast!)
#9-10: @ 1:50/100m
15s rest all

DESCEND SET (500m):
5x100m descend 1-5
Start easy, #5 all-out

COOL-DOWN (400m):
400m easy choice

workouts.name: Long Ride with Race Efforts
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
15 min easy spin

MAIN SET (90 min):
90 min with race-specific blocks:
- 30 min Zone 2 @ 110-150W
- 15 min @ race effort (155-175W)
- 20 min Zone 2
- 15 min @ race effort
- 10 min Zone 2 to finish

Practice full race nutrition!
Target: 60g carbs/hour

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin home

workouts.name: Brick: Short Bike + Long Run
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE LEG (50 min):
Warm-up: 10 min easy
Main: 35 min Zone 2-3 @ 140-170W
Cool-down: 5 min easy

TRANSITION (2 min):
Quick change, race shoes, go!

RUN LEG (55 min):
45 min easy @ 5:35-5:50/km
Final 10 min @ race effort (5:00-5:10/km)
Practice finishing strong off the bike

weeks.focus: Peak build week - highest intensity before recovery

workouts.name: Maintenance Strength
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
Dynamic stretches

MAIN CIRCUIT (25 min):
2 rounds:
- Squats: 15 reps
- Romanian deadlifts: 12 reps
- Lunges: 10 each leg
- Push-ups: 15 reps
- Plank: 45 sec
- Side plank: 30 sec each
- Hip bridges: 15 reps

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
Stretching

workouts.name: Sustained CSS Set
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (500m):
300m easy freestyle
4x50m drill/swim

PRE-MAIN (300m):
6x50m build @ 1:00

MAIN SET (1600m):
2x800m @ CSS (1:55/100m)
60s rest between
Even pacing - this is your race swim!
Hold stroke count and rhythm

SPEED FINISH (300m):
6x50m fast @ :55

COOL-DOWN (300m):
300m easy

workouts.name: Threshold Intervals
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (20 min):
15 min progressive build
3x30s high cadence bursts
2 min easy

MAIN SET (50 min):
4x10 min @ Threshold (180-200W, 90-100% FTP)
5 min easy spin between
Cadence: 85-95 rpm
Aero position for as long as comfortable

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin

workouts.name: Threshold Intervals
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
10 min easy jog
4x30s strides with 30s easy

MAIN SET (30 min):
6x3 min @ Threshold (4:35-4:50/km)
90 sec easy jog between
HR: 158-168 (Zone 4)
Focus: Strong but controlled

COOL-DOWN (10 min):
10 min easy jog
Stretch well

workouts.name: Race Simulation Swim
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
300m easy freestyle
4x25m sighting practice

RACE SIMULATION (1500m):
1500m continuous @ race pace (1:58-2:00/100m)
Start hard (first 100m fast), settle into rhythm
Sight every 8-10 strokes
Practice bilateral breathing
This is your RACE distance!

MAIN SET (400m):
4x100m descend @ 1:50 interval

COOL-DOWN (300m):
300m very easy

workouts.name: Race Simulation Brick
workouts.description: Full race simulation at goal paces
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE LEG (100 min):
Warm-up: 15 min easy
Main: 75 min at RACE EFFORT:
- Power: 155-175W (78-88% FTP)
- HR: Under 155
- Aero position as much as possible
Cool-down: 10 min easy

Full race nutrition practice!
60g carbs/hour, drink every 15 min

TRANSITION (2 min):
Full T2 practice

RUN LEG (45 min):
40 min at RACE EFFORT (5:00-5:10/km)
First 10 min may feel hard - settle in
Final 5 min: Easy cool-down

This is your confidence-builder!

workouts.name: Long Run with Race Finish
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
5 min easy walk/jog

MAIN SET (75 min):
55 min easy @ 5:40-5:55/km (Zone 2)
Final 20 min @ race pace (5:00-5:10/km)
Practice negative splitting
Nutrition: Gel at 40 min

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
5 min easy walk
Stretch and foam roll

weeks.focus: Recovery week - absorb build phase adaptations

workouts.name: Recovery Swim
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (300m):
300m easy freestyle

DRILL SET (400m):
8x50m drill/swim by 25
Focus on form, not speed

MAIN SET (600m):
6x100m easy @ 2:10/100m with 20s rest
Relaxed, smooth strokes

COOL-DOWN (300m):
200m easy pull
100m easy backstroke

workouts.name: Recovery Spin
workouts.humanReadable:
RECOVERY RIDE:
50 min very easy spinning
Power: Under 110W
Cadence: 90-100 rpm

This is active recovery
No hard efforts!
Enjoy the easy ride

workouts.name: Recovery Run
workouts.humanReadable:
RECOVERY RUN:
25 min very easy jogging @ 6:00-6:20/km
HR: Under 140

STRIDES:
4x20 sec strides at fast (not sprint) pace
40 sec easy between
Keep it light and bouncy

COOL-DOWN:
5 min easy walk

workouts.name: Easy Endurance Ride
workouts.humanReadable:
EASY RIDE:
75 min Zone 2 riding
Power: 110-145W (lower Zone 2)
Include a few 30-sec race effort touches
to keep legs sharp

Stay relaxed, enjoy the ride

workouts.name: Easy Continuous Swim
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (200m):
200m easy freestyle

MAIN SET (1400m):
1000m continuous @ comfortable pace
4x100m easy with 15s rest

COOL-DOWN (200m):
200m easy choice stroke

weeks.focus: Peak phase begins - race simulation, open water

workouts.name: Light Maintenance
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (5 min):
Dynamic stretches

MAIN CIRCUIT (20 min):
2 rounds (light weights only):
- Squats: 12 reps
- Lunges: 8 each leg
- Push-ups: 12 reps
- Plank: 30 sec
- Glute bridges: 12 reps
- Bird dogs: 8 each side

COOL-DOWN (5 min):
Stretching and foam rolling

workouts.name: Open Water Simulation
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
200m easy freestyle
4x50m build

RACE SIMULATION (1500m):
1500m continuous @ RACE PACE (1:58/100m)
Start HARD (first 100m aggressive)
Settle into sustainable rhythm
Sight every 8 strokes
Practice "crocodile eyes" sighting

This is your race distance!

DESCEND SET (500m):
5x100m descend 1-5 @ 1:50 interval

COOL-DOWN (400m):
400m easy pull

workouts.name: Race Pace Ride
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
15 min progressive build
3x20s high cadence

MAIN SET (60 min):
60 min at RACE EFFORT:
- Power: 155-175W (78-88% FTP)
- HR: Under 155
- Full aero position practice
- Practice race nutrition: 60g carbs/hour

This simulates your 40km race bike!

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin

workouts.name: Race Pace Intervals
workouts.description: Practice race pace with good form
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
10 min easy jog
4x30s strides with 30s easy

MAIN SET (30 min):
3x8 min @ Race Pace (5:00-5:10/km)
3 min easy jog between
HR: 150-160
This is your 10K race pace!

COOL-DOWN (10 min):
10 min easy jog

workouts.name: Speed & Race Skills
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
300m easy freestyle
4x25m sprint starts

RACE START PRACTICE (400m):
8x50m @ race start effort
First 25m HARD, settle into rhythm
10s rest between

MAIN SET (1200m):
6x200m @ CSS (1:55/100m) with 15s rest
Hold pace and stroke count

COOL-DOWN (400m):
400m easy

workouts.name: Full Race Simulation Brick
workouts.humanReadable:
RACE SIMULATION DAY!

SWIM (if open water available): 1500m @ race pace
OR Pool: 1500m continuous @ 1:58/100m

T1 PRACTICE:
Full transition routine
Target: Under 2 minutes

BIKE LEG (90 min):
90 min at RACE EFFORT (155-175W)
Full race nutrition!
60g carbs/hour
Aero position throughout

T2 PRACTICE:
Quick change
Target: Under 90 seconds

RUN LEG (40 min):
35 min at RACE EFFORT (5:00-5:10/km)
5 min easy cool-down

This is your dress rehearsal!

workouts.name: Easy Long Run
workouts.description: Recovery long run after race simulation
workouts.humanReadable:
RECOVERY LONG RUN:
70 min easy @ 5:50-6:10/km
HR: 136-148 (Zone 2)

This is active recovery after yesterday
Keep it easy!
Enjoy the run

5 min walk cool-down

workouts.name: Sharpening Swim
workouts.description: Maintain race fitness with quality work
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (500m):
300m easy freestyle
4x50m build @ 1:10

SHARPENING SET (1400m):
4x350m @ race pace (1:58/100m)
30s rest between
Focus on even pacing and rhythm

SPEED (400m):
8x50m alternating:
- #1,3,5,7: Fast @ :50
- #2,4,6,8: Easy @ 1:10

COOL-DOWN (300m):
300m easy

workouts.name: Sweet Spot Maintenance
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
15 min progressive build

MAIN SET (45 min):
3x12 min @ Sweet Spot (168-194W)
5 min easy spin between
Maintain good aero form

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin

workouts.name: Tempo Maintenance
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (12 min):
10 min easy jog
4x30s strides with 30s easy

MAIN SET (25 min):
20 min @ Tempo (5:00-5:10/km)
HR: 150-158 (Zone 3)
Controlled, strong effort

COOL-DOWN (13 min):
10 min easy jog
3 min walk

workouts.name: Easy Aerobic Swim
workouts.description: Maintain swim feel with easy work
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (300m):
300m easy freestyle

MAIN SET (1400m):
4x200m @ 2:00/100m with 20s rest
6x100m @ 2:00/100m with 15s rest
Smooth, relaxed swimming

COOL-DOWN (300m):
200m easy pull
100m easy backstroke

workouts.name: Race Tune-Up Brick
workouts.description: Final hard brick before taper begins
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE LEG (80 min):
Warm-up: 15 min easy
Main: 55 min with race-effort blocks:
- 20 min Zone 2
- 15 min @ race effort (155-175W)
- 10 min Zone 2
- 10 min @ race effort
Cool-down: 10 min easy

TRANSITION (2 min):
Practice T2

RUN LEG (35 min):
10 min easy to settle
20 min @ race pace (5:00-5:10/km)
5 min easy cool-down

workouts.name: Final Long Run
workouts.humanReadable:
FINAL LONG RUN:
75 min @ 5:45-6:00/km (Zone 2)
Even effort throughout

Last 10 min: Pick up to race pace if feeling good

Practice race-day nutrition
Gel at 40 min

This is your last long run!
5 min walk cool-down

weeks.focus: Begin taper - reduce volume, maintain sharpness

workouts.name: Sharpening Swim
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (400m):
300m easy freestyle
4x25m fast starts

RACE PACE SET (1200m):
6x200m @ race pace (1:58/100m)
20s rest between
Hold stroke count and rhythm

SPEED FINISH (300m):
6x50m fast @ :55
Keep legs fresh

COOL-DOWN (300m):
300m easy

workouts.name: Race Openers Ride
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (15 min):
15 min easy spin

OPENER SET (30 min):
30 min with openers:
- 10 min Zone 2
- 5 min @ race effort (155-175W)
- 5 min Zone 2
- 5 min @ race effort
- 5 min Zone 2

COOL-DOWN (15 min):
15 min easy spin

Volume is down, intensity stays!

workouts.name: Race Pace Openers
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (10 min):
10 min easy jog

OPENER SET (20 min):
4x3 min @ race pace (5:00-5:10/km)
2 min easy jog between
Feel sharp and strong

COOL-DOWN (10 min):
10 min easy jog

workouts.name: Easy Swim
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (300m):
300m easy freestyle

MAIN SET (1000m):
5x200m @ 2:00/100m with 20s rest
Smooth and relaxed
Practice sighting

COOL-DOWN (300m):
200m easy pull
100m easy backstroke

workouts.name: Final Tune-Up Brick
workouts.humanReadable:
BIKE LEG (55 min):
Warm-up: 10 min easy
Main: 35 min with:
- 15 min Zone 2
- 10 min @ race effort
- 10 min Zone 2
Cool-down: 10 min easy

TRANSITION (2 min):
Practice T2 one more time!

RUN LEG (25 min):
15 min easy
8 min @ race pace
2 min easy cool-down

Last brick! Stay fresh but sharp.

workouts.name: Easy Run
workouts.humanReadable:
EASY RUN:
40 min @ 5:50-6:10/km (Zone 2)

4x20s strides at the end
Keep legs turning over

5 min walk cool-down

Stay relaxed and fresh!

weeks.focus: RACE WEEK - Rest, sharpen, trust your training

workouts.name: Race Week Swim
workouts.humanReadable:
WARM-UP (300m):
200m easy freestyle
4x25m fast starts

RACE PACE SET (800m):
4x200m @ race pace (1:58/100m)
20s rest between
Focus on rhythm and sighting

COOL-DOWN (300m):
300m very easy

You're ready for race day!

workouts.name: Bike Openers
workouts.humanReadable:
OPENER RIDE:
40 min easy spinning with race touches:

- 15 min easy Zone 2
- 3x2 min @ race effort with 2 min easy between
- 10 min easy to finish

Keep legs fresh and sharp!

workouts.name: Run Openers
workouts.humanReadable:
OPENER RUN:
20 min very easy jog @ 6:00-6:20/km

4x30s @ race pace with 30s easy

5 min easy walk

Legs should feel bouncy and ready!

workouts.name: Pre-Race Swim
workouts.humanReadable:
PRE-RACE SWIM:
Warm-up: 200m easy

Main: 4x100m @ race pace with 15s rest
       4x50m @ 90% with 10s rest

Cool-down: 200m very easy

Feel the water. You're ready!

workouts.name: Race Eve Prep
workouts.humanReadable:
RACE EVE:

Morning: Optional 15 min easy spin or 10 min jog
Just shake out legs if feeling antsy

Afternoon: 
- Check in and get race packet
- Set up transition
- Attend race briefing
- Prep nutrition and gear

Evening:
- Light dinner (familiar foods!)
- Early to bed
- Visualize your race

Trust your training!

workouts.name: OLYMPIC TRIATHLON RACE DAY
workouts.humanReadable:
RACE DAY!

PRE-RACE:
- Wake 3 hours before start
- Breakfast: 100-150g carbs (oatmeal, banana, toast)
- Arrive 90 min early
- Set up transition, check bike
- 200m warm-up swim 15 min before start

SWIM (1500m): ~30-32 min target
- Start positioning based on ability
- First 100m: Hard but controlled
- Settle into 1:58-2:00/100m rhythm
- Sight every 8-10 strokes
- Draft when possible

T1: Under 2 minutes
- Wetsuit off at designated area
- Helmet first, then shoes
- Move quickly but smoothly

BIKE (40km): ~65-70 min target
- First 5 min: Settle, don't surge
- Power: 155-175W (78-88% FTP)
- HR: Under 155
- Aero position, smooth pedaling
- Nutrition: 60g carbs, drink every 15 min
- Save something for the run!

T2: Under 90 seconds
- Shoes off before dismount line
- Run shoes on, race belt, go!

RUN (10km): ~50-52 min target
- First km will feel HARD - normal!
- Settle into 5:00-5:10/km by km 2
- Walk aid stations if needed
- Water and cola at each station
- Push last 2km - you've got this!

TARGET FINISH: 2:45-3:00

Enjoy it - you've earned this!

swim.startStrategy: Position yourself based on ability. If aggressive, go with front pack. If conservative, start wide to avoid contact.
swim.firstLapApproach: First 100m will be fast and chaotic. Go hard to get into position, then settle into sustainable rhythm by 200m mark.
swim.mainPacing: Hold 1:58-2:05/100m throughout. Even splits or slight negative split.

sighting.technique: "Crocodile eyes" - lift just eyes above water, not whole head. Quick look forward during natural head rotation.
sighting.landmarks: Identify bright or unique course markers. Use other swimmers as reference when between buoys.

swim.drafting: Legal and encouraged! Stay at feet or hip of slightly faster swimmer. Saves 10-20% energy.
swim.exitStrategy: Increase kick intensity last 100m to prepare legs for bike. Sight often for swim exit. Stand up gradually to avoid dizziness.

bike.firstKmApproach: CRITICAL: First 5km at 150W or lower! Heart rate from swim will be elevated. Let it settle before pushing.
bike.mainPacing: Steady power, not steady speed. Power may vary on hills but aim for consistent output. Avoid surges.
bike.cadence: 85-95 rpm optimal. Higher on climbs (100+) if comfortable.
bike.position: Aero bars as much as possible. Only sit up for technical sections, fueling, and steep climbs.

hills.climbing: Stay seated when possible. Gear down early, maintain cadence. Power may spike 10-15W.
hills.descending: Tuck, recover, but don't stop pedaling entirely. Maintain momentum.

paceByKm.0-10: Settle in, find rhythm. Power 150-165W. Don't chase!
paceByKm.10-25: Steady race effort. Power 155-175W. Focus on form.
paceByKm.25-35: Maintain. Start taking final nutrition. Power 155-175W.
paceByKm.35-40: Prepare for run. Increase cadence. Power 150-170W.

nutrition.timing: Eat/drink every 15-20 min. Set watch reminder!
nutrition.strategy: Front-load nutrition. Take most calories in first half of bike. Switch to lighter options (gels, sports drink) in final 10km.

commonMistakes: Going too hard first 5-10km (ruins the run!)
Forgetting to increase cadence before dismount

run.targetHR: Under 165 bpm initially, can rise to 170+ in final 2km

offTheBike.firstKm: Will feel TERRIBLE. This is normal! Heart rate high, legs heavy. Run by feel, not pace.
offTheBike.strategy: Start 10-15 sec/km slower than target. Walk through first aid station if needed.
offTheBike.adaptation: Legs should 'find' their running rhythm by km 2-3. Gradually increase to race pace.

paceByKm.0-2: Settle. 5:15-5:30/km. Don't panic at slow pace!
paceByKm.2-5: Build to race pace. 5:05-5:15/km. Find rhythm.
paceByKm.5-8: Maintain. 5:00-5:10/km. This is the 'hold on' section.
paceByKm.8-10: Empty the tank! 4:50-5:05/km. Push to finish line.

aidStations.strategy: Walk through first 1-2 stations. Running through wastes more time than walking and drinking properly.
aidStations.hydration: Cup of water at every station. Pour some on head if hot.
aidStations.nutrition: Cola or flat sports drink. Small amounts frequently.

mentalCues: First km doesn't count - just survive it
Catch one person at a time
Finish line is closer every step
commonMistakes: Starting too fast off the bike
Stopping to stretch (keeps moving, even if walking)
Giving up when legs feel heavy (they improve!)

t1.setup: Bike racked with helmet on handlebars. Shoes attached to bike if using speed lacing. Race belt with number attached.
execution: Start wetsuit removal before reaching transition (pull down to waist in water or while running)
Locate your rack row and position
Remove wetsuit completely at your spot or designated area
Shoes on (or attached to bike for flying mount)
Grab bike, run to mount line
tips: Practice finding your spot - use permanent landmarks
Sunglasses can wait until on bike
Body glide on ankles helps wetsuit removal

t2.setup: Run shoes with speed laces. Hat or visor. Race belt already on from T1.
execution: Increase cadence in final km of bike
Unclip shoes on bike if using flying dismount
Shoes on, grab anything else needed
tips: Keep it simple - shoes and go
Skip socks if trained without them
Have small towel to wipe feet if conditions are wet

preRace.dayBefore: Carb-rich dinner (pasta, rice, potato). Normal portions, don't overeat. Stay hydrated. Avoid fiber and heavy fats.

morningOf.meal: 100-150g carbs from familiar foods: oatmeal with banana and honey, toast with jam, or sports drink
morningOf.hydration: 500ml water or sports drink with breakfast

preRace.final30min: Sip water or sports drink. Optional: Half gel 10-15 min before start.

duringRace.swim: Nothing needed. Focus on technique and pacing.

bike.schedule: Every 15-20 min. Set watch reminder. Don't skip!

run.strategy: Small sips water at every aid station. Cola or sports drink for quick energy. Gel at km 5 if needed.

nutrition.practiceNote: NOTHING NEW ON RACE DAY. Practice your nutrition plan on long training days. Know what your stomach tolerates.
nutrition.backup: Know what's on course and have practiced with it. Race-provided nutrition is your backup.

taper.intensityNote: Volume drops significantly but keep short race-pace touches to stay sharp.
guidelines: Week 11: 70% of peak volume, maintain some intensity
Week 12: 40-50% of peak volume, short openers only
Nutrition: Increase carbs slightly, stay hydrated
Mental: Visualize your race, stay calm
Physical: Light activity, stretching, stay loose
commonMistakes: Training too much because you feel 'fresh'
Overeating carbs and gaining water weight
Staying up late or drinking alcohol

mentalPreparation.visualization: Night before and morning of race: Visualize yourself successfully completing each leg. See yourself having a great swim exit, smooth transitions, strong bike, and finishing the run strong.
mantras: Pain is temporary, pride is forever

contingencyPlans.badSwim: It's only 1500m. Settle down, find rhythm. You have 40km and 10km to make up time.
contingencyPlans.mechanicalIssue: Stay calm. Fix it and continue. Finishing is always the priority.
contingencyPlans.bonk: Slow down, take in calories, walk if needed. You can always recover and finish.
contingencyPlans.bad weather: Same race for everyone. Dress appropriately. Adjust pace expectations on bike.

preRaceMeal.content: 100-150g carbs: Oatmeal, banana, toast with honey, or familiar breakfast

warmUp.swim: 200-300m easy swim 10-15 min before start. Get body used to water temperature. Practice sighting.
warmUp.general: Light jog or walking to stay loose

mentalCues: Trust your training - you've done the work
Race YOUR race - don't get caught up with others
Enjoy the experience - you trained 12 weeks for this!
When it hurts, that's when you're racing
